Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: LeonA_024
Reviews.Content: Staff seemed friendly till we had a complaint. We found hair inside of coffee pot (looked like pubic hair) when we brought it to the staffs attention we didnt recieve an apology. The just washed the pot out and placed it on our table while we were eating breakfast. BTW breakfast sucks. Hotel description stated that there is a parking garage on the premises, which is misleading because the parking garage is FAR from the hotel. Hallways leading to the hotel rooms were cold, especially by the elevator. Bathrooms very small and uncomfortable and 110V doesn't work! Description also stated it had view of city, the should have said it was a view of neighbors with laundry hanging from the window & trash on floor. Not recommended for family visit.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for bed&breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Olya Z
Reviews.Content: It's a simple and small hotel just for one purpose - sleep, although breakfasts are very tasty there also. Other than that - it's very very tiny, rooms are so tiny, that you can't properly open the door to the bathroom. Maybe not the cleenest hotel I've seen, but you can deal with it. Rooms have safe for documents if any. Good location - around 20-25 minute walk from the center, nice and comfy beds, but a little too noisy in the morning from the outside. Staff seemed to be very very very nice to me, thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff, disgusting hotel”
Reviews.Author: karren r
Reviews.Content: This hotel ruined our stay in Amsterdam. We had a quad room. From the first minute we entered there was a terrible smell coming from the bathroom, which they refused to address. They said they could not change our room because the hotel was booked, so we had to use a nasty public restroom in the hallway. There is no way this is a 3 star hotel. I've traveled and stayed in hostels in Europe, and hotels in west africa-and this was by far the worst. The staff were very rude, the manager yelled at me when I asked for new towels because the ones in our bathroom smelled like sewage. I would strongly recommend avoiding this place! I wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic ....”
Reviews.Author: Dench T
Reviews.Content: First impressions are dirty bathroom which has visible mould and a mouldy smell and no visible means for moisture to exit. Bed too soft but sheets and towels clean. No small fridge or small area to say make toast or have a very light meal. Quiet at night which is good after a day spent walking around the city. Lighting very low but this seems to be usual in European cities to save energy I guess, but one strong light would have been helpful. Internet access has to be paid for (whereas many hotels now provide it for free). Breakfast quite good, buffet style for 10 euros per person. Location is also good.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: triptips_11
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't say this was the cheapest place to stay but as Amsterdam prices go it must be one of them. Our original check in was friendly and helpful and the receptionist helped show us places to eat and areas to visit on a map and the best way to get around. First impressions were good, the room was small (room 137) and decorated as the pictures would have you believe (almost). Unfortunately our TV didn't work and after a new remote and battery change it still didn't work so after one simple complaint we were upgraded to a much larger room on the ground floor on the following night. Rooms were clean and sufficient could do with fresh lick of paint though as some areas were not so nice but you can look past that when you know it is only for a few nights. All in all a private stay and helpful reception but would try somewhere else on another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, otherwise adequate”
Reviews.Author: John01778
Reviews.Content: First the bad: These people clearly do not want to be working here. We experienced two different people at the front desk, neither one of which ever cracked a smile, both of whom gave the absolute minimum effort to anyone who had the nerve to interrupt their video games (or whatever it was they were doing on the computer). They both had the same accent (Russian, maybe?), but their demeanor was not simply due to some cultural difference - they were downright smarmy. Fortunately, we didn't need much from them anyway and had relatively few encounters with them. Had they been more helpful, we may have relied on them more for such things as calling a cab or asking directions, but it just wasn't worth the aggravation. Other than the bad service, the shower could have been warmer and stronger. The Good: The room was adequate - simple, small, but clean. The location was good, central to the Anne Frank House, the Van Gogh Museum, etc. While I would never say never, I would only stay here again if I could find nothing else.

Reviews.Title: “If you have time keep looking......”
Reviews.Author: sadzi16
Reviews.Content: This was the second hotel that I stayed in during my trip to Amsterdam this summer. It was not the best. The bathroom was dirty and didnt look like it had been clean. The good thing about it was that it was not too far from the city center and about a 15-20 minute walk. If you need a place to lay your head for a night, its ok, but if you have time, I would keep looking.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: deepest_blue17
Reviews.Content: Great value for a boutique hotel. We were very close to the '9' streets around the canals. There were plenty of nice shops & restaurants around the hotel & everything was within walking distance. There is an awesome burger shop 3 min. away! A small grocery & organic foodshop is also only a 5 min walk away! Room was kept clean & there was a t.v. with cable.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing flash but good for short stays and great location”
Reviews.Author: sjkAustralia
Reviews.Content: Easy to get to, catch a tram from Centraal Station and only a 5 minute walk to hotel. Location is great for getting something to eat or drink from doner kebabs and frites to steak and thai. Walking to museums, red light district and flower markets is easy and can be quite scenic. Hotel itself is nothing fancy, the rooms at first seem like a converted school or hospital and have that dormitory feel but they're comfortable and clean enough, the bathroom ceiling could have used a bit of bleach but we were happy with our choice of accommodation. Service was helpful, if not a little aloof at first. The breakfast staff were great, made coffee to order and there was plenty to eat including scrambled eggs. We were able to access the internet and borrow an iron and ironing board, a laundry service was just around the corner so we had a bag of clothes washed and dried for only 8 euros.

Reviews.Title: “An adequate hotel for short breaks”
Reviews.Author: DelandPauline
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests for a short break this hotel was adequate, room was clean, bed was comfortable but the en-suite, although servicable, was rather small. The hotel is located off the beaten track and the only way we found it initially was to get a taxi from the station. Once found, the city centre was easily walkable although the number 17 tram could be picked up nearby that took you to centraal station. Breakfast was a cold buffet affair but always plenty to eat and drink. The only downside was that there was no hairdrier located in the room.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable hotel within easy reach of all attractions.”
Reviews.Author: FoweyChinnor
Reviews.Content: Get Train from Airport to Central Station, then No 17 Tram...5 stops, then a very short walk to hotel. This hotel is a good base! You can walk to Flower Market and every other museum along the way...then just get Tram back if you are tired! Good bar a few yards away on corner...Cafe Chaos! Nice to relax there at the end of the evening! Also, for a Meal, go to Cafe De Doffer..left out of hotel & left again & continue walking til you find it! The food there is very good and certainly a place to end evening [before going onto Cafe Chaos after!]. In Town, we had the best meal ever [nd we are Good Food Guide] at De Haven van Texel [Sint Olofssteeg 11]...going down from Central Station, to left!

Reviews.Title: “Defends the price - very centrally located close to the most important attractions.”
Reviews.Author: freberg
Reviews.Content: OK for a few nights stay-over, but no open bar/restaurant in the evenings. A place to sleep and eat breakfast. Staff not too overly wellcoming/enthusiastic. Clean rooms. Very centrally located to the canals and the attractions to see. Quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice size room, but DIRTY towels and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: pichonita
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a thursday afternoon, the receptionist was VERY helpful! I received ALOT of useful info with map and tram info etc. Breakfast was nice, coffee/tea included. HOWEVER!! Be sure to ASK the room cleaner for CLEAN towels! the first 2 days was fine, but when she cleaned my room, she DIDN'T change the sheets and the towels she left were absolutely DISGUSTING!! Like the dirty guy from next door had used them all week, then put them in room. No fridge, and no hair dryer. A little noisy as the doors are very thin, BUT I stayed 4 nights, confident It was a safe area and room. It was warm, and comfortable, and shower was excellent! i would recommend, but NOT 3 stars, and NOT at the asking price. Some nights were 44 euros, and some 80 euros up! I would NOT pay this price for this kind of hotel. If you want quality, pay MORE! thats my advice. ALSO, NO FREE INTERNET! 15 euros for 3 days-so not too bad!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Believe The Photos”
Reviews.Author: Nomissivad
Reviews.Content: Like someone else who has written a review for this hotel, we were staying in room 20 of this hotel on the ground floor and it was not a pleasant experience at all. The room looked like it was used to make cheap adult films with a wall of mirrors along one side and unidentified stains on the walls and bedside tables. The beds were so cheap and nasty that it was virtually impossible to sleep on them and the noise from the restaurant on the opposite side of the corridor was the cherry on the cake. If you are into seedy youth hostels then this is the place for you but if you think that it looks like a trendy, minimalist, mid-range quality hotel, I can assure you that it is not!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: fizzpot
Reviews.Content: Booked a last minute deal on Thomas cook website so weren't exactly expecting a 5 star. On arrival we checked in and were told we were on the third floor. Thankfully there was a working lift because the stairs were so steep. The room was clean and pleasant, if a bit small. It may look well decorated on the photos that advertise the hotel however the halls are discusting. The bathroom was very small with hardly any room to even sit on the toilet!! When getting into bed we realised the room smelt quite badly of rotten eggs (which we asumed was the drainage system) Not only this we could hear everything that went on in the hotel at night.We were quite unlucky to find we were next door to a loud couple. The room was also advertised with a hair dryer. It didn't have one. When asking the reception for advice they didn't seem interested. One time we handed our key in on the way out of the hotel and werent even aknowledged by the lady on reception and were dissapointed to see the key hadnt moved from the desk even when we left the hotel. On the day of our check out the maids knocked on our door at 9am to clean the room (bearing in mind check out time was 11am) we told them we were still here and they left. 20 minutes later they knocked again, knowing we hadn't left. We told them again and they hung around outside our room talking very loudly to make sure we knew they were waiting. Also it advertises a bar - there isnt one. I would not recomend this hotel to anyone unless you are looking for a cheap deal for a good location. I couldn't have stayed here longer than 2 nights and I am a student!!! A definate no no for old people and children.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Wil82
Reviews.Content: In general, this is a good hotel. The room is quite space as well as the bathroom. The bed sleeps comfortable too. If there is more choice of breakfast, it will even be better.

Reviews.Title: “made me feel sick”
Reviews.Author: checkitout_10
Reviews.Content: The pics you see on line do not show the dirt and mold in the rooms. When I got there I wished I had paid a bit more and stayed somewhere else. The people that work there are scary!!! I didn't want to complain to much because I didn't want to get robbed. The beds don't had real mattresses on them they are like a futon or camper mattress. The pillows are flat as pancakes. I slept on top of the blankets and didn't move all night because I was afraid to touch my face on anything. The breakfast is toast, yogurt and canned fruit cocktail. I am very easy going and wasn't expecting much! I wasn't expecting dirty!! Anywhere in Amsterdam is a good location, you can walk anywhere from Vondlepark to Central station so don't worry about being close to anything in particular. In conclusion DONT STAY HERE!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel! Go stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: woohoo88
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not worth the rate they are charging. It is about a 1 star hotel or a hotel but goes for a rate of minimum 120 Euro per night. This hotel is NOT worth the money as you can find a much better hotel in a better location for the same price. Keep looking! Our room was so small we could not open the bathroom door without hitting the bed. The telephone and safe in the room did not work. There was a huge hole in the ceiling outside our door and they didn't even have one extra blanket when we asked. The receptionists are a bit of a hit and miss. The man there never smiled once over 3 days but the woman was kind and helpful. The breakfast is cheap but has enough to fill you. Just go early as they do not put more food out after 9:30am so if you are late coming there is no food left for you. Overall, NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but pleasant. Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: DisneyParisfan
Reviews.Content: Initially booked to stay at the Hotel de Paris we were bumped to here due to a dubious booking problem. Better location than that hotel anyway, and looked cleaner with more pleasant staff. We had a 3 bed room, on the first floor. We used the stairs but a lift was available (and was working) The room was clean and warm and very spacious. The main room lights werent working but there were lamps on all the beds and a table lamp on the desk so this was hardly a problem. The toilet and shower room was clean, if small, though the door wouldnt open completely as one of the beds was too close! The breakfast was pleasant- croissants, rolls, toast, cheese, meats, scrambled eggs (one day with fish???) and plentiful coffee, tea and fruit juice. There is a computer available for a small cost in the lobby, and the staff are helpful and friendly, happily giving me assistance with printing my boarding passes for my return flight. The trams are nearby, the no. 17 taking you quickly to the centre and the 7 or 10 only 2 stops from the entertainment area. Although not overlooking any canals, they are at the end of the street and make a pleasant walk if you wish so are by no means a loss. The hotel was not the poshest of locations, but was well worth the cost and was a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You can do so much better !!”
Reviews.Author: Andreea555
Reviews.Content: basically the hotel is not bad, unless you decide to look at the walls and doors that definitely need to be repaired. it looks more like a 2star than a 3star hotel, but it's located pretty close to the main square and even closer to the bars and clubs area. the staff did not seem very nice in the beginning, but proved to be very helpful. the only problem is that the room is not worth the 140 euro we paid. however, if you only have one night in Amsterdam and you want to be in walking distance, then this hotel is pretty well located.

Reviews.Title: “You Can Do Better”
Reviews.Author: Englishman35
Reviews.Content: Stayed with 2 teens in June, we wanted a room to accomodate 4 in the Musuem area, which is what we got. But its not a 3* more like 2, the staff are very pleasant and helpful, breakfast was fine with unlimited coffee and continental included, clean and pleasant. The room was another matter, alas very small and not really big enough for beds for 4, the bathroom was literally a cupboard and the water ran out and into the room, simply not good enough. Room was clean and quiet with no view. Not bad value if you throw in breakfast, but make sure you get a decent room and don't pay up its not worth it. Location wise, quite good in a very nice neighbourhood of Jordaan, a very nice place to stay, 10 minutes to Leidsplein for restaurants and bars, close to Anne Frank Hse which is must when visiting, you'll need to queue but it moves quickly enough, leave a visit until late afternoon or evening, take a canal cruise , visit the Van Gogh whilst the Riks is closed until later this year.

Reviews.Title: “the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: carriagafrias
Reviews.Content: In fact, I'm Surprised that the woman who made the breakfast in the hotel did not understand English language I asked her if possible to take a breakfast for my friend to the room but she gave me coffee, so I said that not my questios !, and she gave me tea, at the end I knew that she did not understand the English language Finally,I said to her Thank you and then I went. In this case, the hotel is the one who lost the price of breakfast Sent to you attached image of this women.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly & Clean.”
Reviews.Author: Garys-missus
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a very wet Friday, found the hotel with little difficulty. We were met by friendly and helpful staff. The room was clean and warm (once we'd turned the radiator on). There were clean towels daily. The bed was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was basic but plentifull. It was close enough to all the sights, about a 15 min walk. Would use again.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly in need of refurbishment!”
Reviews.Author: GillianCage
Reviews.Content: 16-18 July 2008 I stayed with friends at the Hotel De Looier for a weekend. The plus points were - friendly and helpful staff, beds were comfortable and clean and the bathroom was clean with plenty of clean towels. The hotel is in a quiet location within walking distance of Leidesplein where you can find a good selection of bars and restaurants. From there it is easy to take a tram to Dam Square and other tourist attractions. On the down-side the hotel was in desperate need of refurbishment and there was an awful smell in the lift (probably the drains). The breakfast was ok, we did check the dates on the butter as an earlier review said that this was past its use-by date but it was actually the brown bread that we found to be mouldy! Worst of all for us - three girls sharing a room - was that we had no mirror in our room - an absolute necessity for getting ready for a night out!! We did mention this at reception but nothing was done about it! Also one of our beds was folded up against the wall which we had to assemble and make up ourselves. I certainly won't stay here again unless they give it a complete make-over!

Reviews.Title: “in need of some tlc”
Reviews.Author: hubnut23
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here and it was a disappointing last night of our holdiay. Amsterdam is pricey in general and this seemed one of the more reasonably priced places and was rated as three stars. The staff were friendly and helpful but the hotel itself really needs to have some money spent on it. The hotel blurb says that it was recently renovated, I don't think so. The decor and furnishings were old, dated and fraying at the edges. For example the back was coming off the wardrobe, the bedroom carpet had a number of worked in stains and bald patches, the bathroom door had a hole in it, the woodwork had graffiti on it and the grouting in the bathroom was mouldy and brown. The breakfast room resembled an eighties disco, the breakfast itself was okay, the coffee and eggs were good. On the plus side the bed mattresses appeared to have been replaced reasonable recently and the linen and towels were reasonable quality and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: bullybilbo
Reviews.Content: I think the De Looier was the worst hotel I've ever had the misfortune to stay in. The room was dirty, as we found the hotel in general. The smell, of what I presume was the drains, was nauseating. It was a dark dingy hole. In fairness the location wasn't bad. We made the stupid mistake of waiting in reception one day whilst our room was cleaned, leaving a mobile phoneon the side.......the mobile was never seen again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter24
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner and we were happily surprised. The hotel is down a back street so it is very quiet. The room we stayed in was clean and big. The breakfast wasn't great and we would just have coffee and eat out. But the staff was friendly and the hotel was in a safe area. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice,comfy hotel”
Reviews.Author: aj72
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a 3 night stay in the de Looier hotel and we had a great stay. The hotel is a two minute walk from the Marlay bus station (no 370 goes directly from the airport 3euro), and is a 5 min walk from Leidseplein, and is in a safe,quiet area. The staff were very nice and helpful and gave us maps and directions. The hotel was very clean and well kept and our room was large and the beds very comfortable. We paid 385 euros for the 3 nights incl breakfast and would definately return to this hotel next time we visit amsterdam. :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room in a cosy hotel”
Reviews.Author: Komsomol
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a triple room with my mother and a close friend. The price was â‚¬125 which is expensive but among the cheapest acceptable alternatives in Amsterdam during the high season. The hotel is situated in a quiet area in the inner city about 10 minutes by foot from the Dam Square. The hotel is close to the tram stop Elandsgracht where trams 7,10 and 17 stop. The hotel has a laid back atmosphere with a cat sleeping in the corridors. There was absolutely no smell of anybody smoking any dodgy cigarettes which is very nice if that's not your thing. The room was big enough with a double and a single bed. However the door to the bathroom didn't open completely as the bed stood to close to it. The bathroom itself was quite small and had a shower. The rooms was very clean and had a TV-set but no remote control. The breakfast was nice with cold meats, cereals, two different sorts of bread, cheese, jam and sponge cake. The breakfast staff was OK however they started to remove the various breakfast items a couple of minutes to 10 even though the breakfast was supposed to end at 10 which made you feel uncomfortable, stressed and unwanted there. The reception staff was indifferent. All in all a satisfactory yet overpriced alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: AussieSimon
Reviews.Content: The hotel was generally quite good and is located on a quiet street. The room was spacious and clean, and the bathroom was good. It was very hot (middle of a heatwave) but the staff were very helpful and actually purchased a fan for us! The breakfast was very good compared to other 3-star hotel breakfasts. Perhaps the only drawback is its distance from the city centre - it is about a 20 minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station, although the walk goes through some very nice streets including the antiques shops. It is, however, possible to take the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Melbsteve
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel and I was not dissapointed.The hotel is well located and is only 5mins walk from my favourite square in Amsterdam, Leidesplein, which is full of open air cafes, restaurants and within walking distance of the museums and boat cruise stations. To get to the hotel its a simple tramride from the centraal station, a journey that takes about 5mins. The hotel is in a nice and quiet side street facing the canal in the antique quarter so is surrounded by small antique shops and a couple of quiet bars, the staff are very friendly and helpful, the rooms neat and tidy with ensuite facilities and the buffet breakfast excellant with the usual mix of boiled eggs, meats, pastries and toasts. The main advantage of this hotel is that its excellant value and has a great location, and I wouldnt hesitate to stay there again next time I'm in Amsterdam, which hopefully wont be too far away.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Looier
HotelInfo.Address: Derde Looiersdwarsstraat 75, Amsterdam 1016 VD, The Netherlands
